intro: Thlaspi collinum, commonly known as mountain cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often at elevations above 1,500 meters. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are usually hairy and lobed. Thlaspi collinum is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, cold environments and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
